titleInfo.title: Brought to the First District Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the First District Police Prison -- ELIZABETH, a black, 5 feet 3 inches high, 21 years old -- says she belongs to Mrs. Josephine Garcia. EDMUND MURRAY, a light griffe, 5 feet 6 1/2 inches high, 20 years old, has a scar on the left arm -- says he is free, but supposed to be a runaway slave. JOHN WESLEY, a light griffe, 4 feet 10 inches high, 15 years old, blind of left eye -- says he belongs to Mr. Huntington. JOHN WILLIAMS, a black, 4 feet 5 inches high, about 13 years old, has both arms cut off, and several small scars on forehead -- says he is free, but supposed to be a runaway slave. HENRY, a mulatto, 5 feet 6 inches high, 21 years old -- says he belongs to Mr. Hall. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. JONATHAN WORRALL, Warden. NewOrleans, August 20, 1853. au 20 1aw3w
mods.note: Mrs. Josephine Garcia; Mr. Huntington; Mr. Hall
Elizabeth (21); Edmund Murray (20); John Wesley (15); John Williams (13); Henry (21)

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
